column2: Tindak Malaysia (2024), Government Gazette P.U. (B) 184 19th March 1981, Laporan Pilihanraya Umum Dewan Undangan Negeri Sabah 1981, Suruhanjaya Pilihan Raya  Refer to 1981_Other_Sources for other source files

According to the New Sunday Times of 11th March 1981, Barisan Sabah consists of USNO, SCCP, and PASOK. However, PASOK and USNO did clash with each other. Hence, PASOK is separated from Barisan Sabah list. USNO is part of Barisan Nasional (BN) until it was kicked out from BN in April 1984 but played as a state opposition. Following candidates where the sex category require more validation - Chin Kok Kong (BERJAYA), Mok Shuo Khyun (DAP), Liew Kong Khai (DAP), Yong Yung Lee (Independent - Candle) and Thu Voi Hiang (Independent - Wau). There are missing information of Independent Symbol for certain Independent Candidates. Independent Candidates of Tham Yin Kong and Stanislaus Puyuseh Masri pulled out from election race after nomination, according to New Straits Times 11/3/1981. Bengkoka Elections were postponed after one candidate passed away on 17th March 1981, 6 days before elections and new nomination date was 9th April 1981 and elections were held for Bengkoka from 24th April to 29th April 1981.
